details.text: Hafez Al-Assad (PEP) (father) (deceased). Anisa Al-Assad (mother). Mahir Al-Assad (PEP) (brother). Majd Al-Assad (brother) (deceased). Bushra Al-Assad (sister). Assef Shawkat (PEP) (brother-in-law) (deceased). Asma Al-Assad (spouse). Hafez Al-Assad (son). Kareem Al-Assad (son). Zein Al-Assad (daughter). Fawaz Akhras (father-in-law). Sahar Akhras (mother-in-law). Eyad Akhras (brother-in-law). Feras Akhras (brother-in-law). Fawwaz Al-Assad (cousin). Muhammad Makhluf (uncle). Jamil Al-Assad (PEP) (uncle) (deceased). Atif Najib (PEP) (cousin). Fatima Makhlouf (aunt). Munzir Al-Assad (cousin). Numeir Al-Asad (cousin). Siwar Al-Assad (cousin).
details.title: IDENTIFICATION

details.text: President of Syria (Jul 2000 - Jul 2007) (Jul 2007 - Jun 2014) (Jun 2014 - ). Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces (Jun 2000 - ). Secretary General of the Baath Arab Socialist Party (Jun 2000 - ).

sources.name: PEP - National Government

category.description: This gives details of high-ranking government officials in over 200 countries. Although there may be no reason why you should not do business with these individuals, the Basle Committee on Banking supervision has stated that one should check these customers because without this due diligence, banks can become subject to reputational, operational, legal and concentration risks, which can result in significant financial cost.
category.name: PEP
